Name: Pyramidion
Description: A pyramidion belonging to the official Neferrenpet, made from black granite and inscribed on all four sides. Neferrenpet was a vizier during the reign of Ramesses II and also High Priest of Ptah at Memphis. There is a statue of him at Leiden and a stela in Berlin.Pyramidions became a popular type of funerary monument during the New Kingdom. They were usually placed outside of the tomb and, like stela, gave the names and titles of the deceased and relatives.
